en: The word that Jehovah spake concerning Babylon, concerning the land of the Chaldeans, by Jeremiah the prophet.
hmr: Zâwlnei Jeremia hmanga, Kal- daihai ram chungthu, Babulon chungthua LALPA thuhril chu:

en: Declare ye among the nations and publish, and set up a standard; publish, and conceal not: say, Babylon is taken, Bel is put to shame, Merodach is dismayed; her images are put to shame, her idols are dismayed.
hmr: “Hnamhai laia chun hril la, phuong rawh, chun, puonzâr chu khai la, phuong la, thup naw rawh, ‘Babulon chu lâkin a um a, Bêl chu sukzak a na, Merodak chu a bei- dawng a, a milimhai po po chu sukzakin an um a, a milimhai chu an beidawng zo tah,’ ti rawh.

en: For out of the north there cometh up a nation against her, which shall make her land desolate, and none shall dwell therein: they are fled, they are gone, both man and beast.
hmr: Hmârtienga inthawk chun hnam pakhat a ram chu râusana siema tukhawm chêng lo dinga siem dingin a hung mêk a; an tlânseh a, mihriem le ramsahai khawm chu, an fe hmang zo tah a.

en: In those days, and in that time, saith Jehovah, the children of Israel shall come, they and the children of Judah together; they shall go on their way weeping, and shall seek Jehovah their God.
hmr: Chuong niahai chun, chuong hunahai chun, LALPA chun a tih: Israel thlahai chu hung an ta, anni le Juda thlahai chu a ruolin hung an ta; an ṭap malamin hung an ta, LALPA an Pathien chu zawng an tih.

en: They shall inquire concerning Zion with their faces thitherward, saying, Come ye, and join yourselves to Jehovah in an everlasting covenant that shall not be forgotten.
hmr: Hma sawngin Zion chu râwn an ta, ‘Hung ve ro, theinghila um ta ngai lo ding chatuon thuthlung chun LALPA chu hung zawm ve ro khai,’ tîng an tih.

en: My people have been lost sheep: their shepherds have caused them to go astray; they have turned them away on the mountains; they have gone from mountain to hill; they have forgotten their resting-place.
hmr: “Ka mihai chu berâm inhmang- hai an lo ni tah a, an vêngtuhai chun anni chu tlângahai chun inherhmang- tirin, an ṭhuoi hmang a; tlânga in- thawkin muola dâm chun an fe a, an riekna hmun chu an theinghil tah a.

en: All that found them have devoured them; and their adversaries said, We are not guilty, because they have sinned against Jehovah, the habitation of righteousness, even Jehovah, the hope of their fathers.
hmr: A hmu taphawthai hlak chun anni chu an fâkzo a, an hmêlmahai chun, ‘Thudik umna LALPA, an thla- tuhai beiseitak, LALPA chunga chun thil an suksuol lei a nih, ei sukpawi nawh,’ an tih a.

en: Flee out of the midst of Babylon, and go forth out of the land of the Chaldeans, and be as the he-goats before the flocks.
hmr: Babulona inthawk chun tlânsuok unla, Kaldaihai rama inthawk chun fe suok unla, kêl ruol hmaa kêlchal ang ni ro.

en: For, lo, I will stir up and cause to come up against Babylon a company of great nations from the north country; and they shall set themselves in array against her; from thence she shall be taken: their arrows shall be as of an expert mighty man; none shall return in vain.
hmr: Ngai ta u, hmârtieng rama inthawka hnam ropuitak inkhâwm chu Babulon hung rûn dingin hung chawktho ka ta, in hungtir ka tih; a chunga chun hung intlar an ta; chutaka inthawk chun lâkin um a ta, an thalhai chu mi hrât indo thiemtak a thlâwna kîr nâwk ngai naw ang a nih.

en: And Chaldea shall be a prey: all that prey upon her shall be satisfied, saith Jehovah.
hmr: Chuongchun, Kaldai chu râllâk- sum hung nîng a ta, ama suksetuhai taphawt chu lungawi êm êm an tih, LALPA chun a tih.

en: Because ye are glad, because ye rejoice, O ye that plunder my heritage, because ye are wanton as a heifer that treadeth out the grain, and neigh as strong horses;
hmr: Aw nangni ka rochan hung rûntuhai, in hlima in lâwm lei le, sazukpui bu chilse a, sakawr hrâttak inhrâm anga in tha a fân leiin; in nu chu nasatakin inzak a tih;

en: your mother shall be utterly put to shame; she that bare you shall be confounded: behold, she shall be the hindermost of the nations, a wilderness, a dry land, and a desert.
hmr: nangni neitu cheu chu buoi a ta, ngai ta u, hnam po poa hnuoihnung tak, thlalêr le, ram ṭâwl le fienriel hmun nîng a tih.

en: Because of the wrath of Jehovah she shall not be inhabited, but she shall be wholly desolate: every one that goeth by Babylon shall be astonished, and hiss at all her plagues.
hmr: LALPA lunginsenna lei chun hluoin um naw nih a, a pumpuia râusan nîng a ta, mi tin Babulon fekhêltuhai phawt chun mak tîng an ta, a sietna po poa chun inchek an tih.

en: Set yourselves in array against Babylon round about, all ye that bend the bow; shoot at her, spare no arrows: for she hath sinned against Jehovah.
hmr: Babulon chu a vêlin nangni khawma intlar khum ro, thalngul kuoituhai, ama chu kâp unla, thal chu ren naw ro, LALPA chungah thil a lo suksuol ta sih a.

en: Shout against her round about: she hath submitted herself; her bulwarks are fallen, her walls are thrown down; for it is the vengeance of Jehovah: take vengeance upon her; as she hath done, do unto her.
hmr: A vêlin ama chu khêkkhum unla; ama chu a hung inpêklût tah a, a kulhai chu a chim a, a banghai chu sukchim an na. Lalpa phubalâkna a ni sih a; ama chunga chun phuba la unla, amain a lo thaw ta ang khan a chunga khawm thaw ve ro.

en: Cut off the sower from Babylon, and him that handleth the sickle in the time of harvest: for fear of the oppressing sword they shall turn every one to his people, and they shall flee every one to his own land.
hmr: Babulona inthawk chu chi thetu chu sât thla unla, busîk laia kâwite hmangtu le chun; nêksâwrna kâwl- hnâm ṭi leiin mi tin chu mâni mihai tiengah kîr seng an ta, mi tin chu mâni rama seng chun tlân an tih.

en: Israel is a hunted sheep; the lions have driven him away: first, the king of Assyria devoured him; and now at last Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon hath broken his bones.
hmr: “Israel chu berâm indar a nih: sakeibakneihai chun ama chu an lo hnawt hmang tah a; a hmasatak chun Assuria lal chun anni chu a fâkzo a; a tâwpah Babulon lal Nebukadnezzar hin a ruhai chu a sukthliek tah a.

en: Therefore thus saith Jehovah of hosts, the God of Israel: Behold, I will punish the king of Babylon and his land, as I have punished the king of Assyria.
hmr: Chuleiin, sipaihai LALPA Israel Pathien chun hieng hin a tih: Ngai ta u, Assuria lal ka hrem ang bawk khan Babulon lal le a ram chu ka hrem ding a nih.

en: And I will bring Israel again to his pasture, and he shall feed on Carmel and Bashan, and his soul shall be satisfied upon the hills of Ephraim and in Gilead.
hmr: Israel chu a tlatna hmuna chun hung ṭhuoi nâwk ka ta, Karmel le Basana chun tlâng a ta, a thla chu Ephraim le Gilead tlângahai chun lungawi tâwk tâng a tih.

en: In those days, and in that time, saith Jehovah, the iniquity of Israel shall be sought for, and there shall be none; and the sins of Judah, and they shall not be found: for I will pardon them whom I leave as a remnant.
hmr: Chuong niahai chun, chuong pha chun, LALPA chun a tih: Israel suolna chu zawng nîng a ta, ieng- khawm um naw ni; chun, Juda suolna khawm chu hmu ni ta naw nih a; a mahla anga ka hla tahai chu ka ngaidam ding a ni sih a.

en: Go up against the land of Merathaim, even against it, and against the inhabitants of Pekod: slay and utterly destroy after them, saith Jehovah, and do according to all that I have commanded thee.
hmr: “Merathaim ram chu, chu ngei chu, Pekod hluotuhai le chun hang rûn ro; anni chu that unla, sukbo- hmang vawng ro, LALPA chun a tih: thu ka pêk ang tak cheu chun thaw unla.

en: A sound of battle is in the land, and of great destruction.
hmr: Suksietna ropuitak le, indona ri chu rama chun a um a.

en: How is the hammer of the whole earth cut asunder and broken! how is Babylon become a desolation among the nations!
hmr: Hnuoi chung po po tubau iengtiziea tlieka innawi el am a ni aw! Iengtiziea Babulon chu hnamhai laia chun râusana um el am a ni aw!

en: I have laid a snare for thee, and thou art also taken, O Babylon, and thou wast not aware: thou art found, and also caught, because thou hast striven against Jehovah.
hmr: I ta dingin châng ka kam a, i âwk a ni tah, aw Babulon, i lo inring nawh a, LALPA chu i kal leiin hmu suokin i um a, manin i um an tah.

en: Jehovah hath opened his armory, and hath brought forth the weapons of his indignation; for the Lord, Jehovah of hosts, hath a work to do in the land of the Chaldeans.
hmr: LALPA chun a râlthuom sie- khâwmna chu a hawng a, a lungin- senna hriemhreihai chu a hung lâk suok a, LALPA sipaihai LALPA chun Kaldaihai rama chun thaw ding a nei sih a.

en: Come against her from the utmost border; open her store-houses; cast her up as heaps, and destroy her utterly; let nothing of her be left.
hmr: Kil tina inthawk chun ama chu hung rûn unla, a siekhâwmna inhai chu hawng unla, ama chu pil dêng pâwng angin dêng pâwng unla, sukse letdêr ro; a ieng iengkhawm hlain um naw raw se.

en: Slay all her bullocks; let them go down to the slaughter: woe unto them! for their day is come, the time of their visitation.
hmr: A bâwngchalhai po po chu that vawng unla, sa thattu kuomah infetir ro; an chung a va rik de! an ni, anni hung hremna hun chu a hung tlung ta sih a. Babulon rama inthawka tlân- sea suokthlenghai râwlhai chu e!

en: The voice of them that flee and escape out of the land of Babylon, to declare in Zion the vengeance of Jehovah our God, the vengeance of his temple.
hmr: “LALPA ei Pathien phubalâkna a biekin phubalâkna ngei chu Ziona hril ding a nih.

en: Call together the archers against Babylon, all them that bend the bow; encamp against her round about; let none thereof escape: recompense her according to her work; according to all that she hath done, do unto her; for she hath been proud against Jehovah, against the Holy One of Israel.
hmr: “Thalkâptuhai, thalngul kuoi- hai po po chu Babulon chunga chun ko khâwm ro; a vêl el chun riekngha unla, chutaka inthawk chun tu- khawm insuokthlengtir naw ro; a sinthaw ang pei chun ama chu thung unla, a lo thaw ta ang tak khan ama chungah thaw ve ro; LALPA chungah, Israel Mi Inthieng chunga chun a lo chapo ta sih a.

en: Therefore shall her young men fall in her streets, and all her men of war shall be brought to silence in that day, saith Jehovah.
hmr: Chuleiin, a tlangvâlhai chu a kawtthlêrahai chun tlûng an ta; chu ni chun a mi indo mihai po po khawm chu sukto ṭawk ṭawk nîng an tih, LALPA chun a tih.

en: Behold, I am against thee, O thou proud one, saith the Lord, Jehovah of hosts; for thy day is come, the time that I will visit thee.
hmr: Ngai ta, nang ka dodâl che a nih, Aw nang mi chapo, LALPA, sipaihai LALPA chun a tih; i ni, ka hung hremna ding che ni chu a hung tlung mêk sih a.

en: And the proud one shall stumble and fall, and none shall raise him up; and I will kindle a fire in his cities, and it shall devour all that are round about him.
hmr: Chun, mi chapo chu insui a ta, tlûng a tih, tukhawma ama chu keitho naw ni hai; a khawpuiahai chun mei sêm ka ta, ama vêla umhai po po chu kâng hmang vawng a tih.

en: Thus saith Jehovah of hosts: The children of Israel and the children of Judah are oppressed together; and all that took them captive hold them fast; they refuse to let them go.
hmr: “Sipaihai LALPA chun hieng hin a tih: Israel thlahai le Juda thla- hai chu nêksâwrin an um rêl a; anni sala mantuhai taphawt hlak chun an chel det tlat a, an infetir nuom nawh a.

en: Their Redeemer is strong; Jehovah of hosts is his name: he will thoroughly plead their cause, that he may give rest to the earth, and disquiet the inhabitants of Babylon.
hmr: Anni sanhimtu chu a hrât a, a hming khawm, sipaihai LALPA a nih, ama chun an chungthu chu ṭan tlat a ta; hnuoi chunga chun châwlna a pêk thei a, Babulon hluotuhai ruok chu a sukto ṭawkṭawk nawna dingin.

en: A sword is upon the Chaldeans, saith Jehovah, and upon the inhabitants of Babylon, and upon her princes, and upon her wise men.
hmr: Kâwlhnâm chu Kaldaihai chunga dâm, Babulon hluotuhai chunga dâm, a rorêltuhai le a mivar- hai chunga chun a um a nih, LALPA chun a tih.

en: A sword is upon the boasters, and they shall become fools; a sword is upon her mighty men, and they shall be dismayed.
hmr: Chapohai chunga chun kâwl- hnâm chu a um a, invêtpui an ta, kâwlhnâm chu a mi thilthawtheihai chungah a um a, beidawng an tih.

en: A sword is upon their horses, and upon their chariots, and upon all the mingled people that are in the midst of her; and they shall become as women: a sword is upon her treasures, and they shall be robbed.
hmr: Kâwlhnâm chu an sakawrhai chunga dâm, an sakawr tawlailîrhai chunga dâm, ama sûnga mi chilakhai po po chunga dâm chun a um a, chuongchun, anni chu nuhmei ang el nîng an ta, kâwlhnâm chu a ro inhai chunga chun a um a, inrûkin um a tih.

en: A drought is upon her waters, and they shall be dried up; for it is a land of graven images, and they are mad over idols.
hmr: A tuihai chunga chun kangna a um a, kangchat an tih; milim ker- fâwm ram a na, milimah an invêt ri ngawt el a ni sih a.

en: Therefore the wild beasts of the desert with the wolves shall dwell there, and the ostriches shall dwell therein: and it shall be no more inhabited for ever; neither shall it be dwelt in from generation to generation.
hmr: “Chuleiin, thlalêr ramsa hrâng- hai chu sihalhai leh chutaka chun chêng an ta; vangalsânghai khawm chêng an ta; kumkhuoin hluo hrim hrim ni ta naw ni; suona inthawka suon dang chena khawm hluo ni naw ni.

en: As when God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah and the neighbor cities thereof, saith Jehovah, so shall no man dwell there, neither shall any son of man sojourn therein.
hmr: Pathien chun Gomorra le Sodom le a vêl khuohai chu a pei thlâk lai ang khan, LALPA chun a tih: chutaka chun mi chêng naw ni hai a, mihriem nau tukhawm chutaka chun inzin khawm vân zin naw ni hai.

en: Behold, a people cometh from the north; and a great nation and many kings shall be stirred up from the uttermost parts of the earth.
hmr: Ngai ta u, hmâr tienga in- thawkin hnam pakhat an hung a, hnam ropuitak el, lal tamtakhai le chun leihnuoi kilkhâwrtaka inthawk chen chun chawktho nîng an ta.

en: They lay hold on bow and spear; they are cruel, and have no mercy; their voice roareth like the sea; and they ride upon horses, every one set in array, as a man to the battle, against thee, O daughter of Babylon.
hmr: Anni chun thalngul le fei an chawi a; an rilo hle a, lunginsietna an nei nawh; an râwlhai chu tuisuoriet angin ân rûm a, sakawr chungahai chun an chuong a; Aw Babulon nau- nu, nangma chunga chun, indonaa mi angin, mi tin chu an intlar a nih.

en: The king of Babylon hath heard the tidings of them, and his hands wax feeble: anguish hath taken hold of him, and pangs as of a woman in travail.
hmr: Babulona lal chun an ri chu a lo hriet a, a kuthai chu a hung chau a, ama chu lunginzîngna chun a man tah a, nuhmei nauhase nat tuor angin a na tah a.

en: Behold, the enemy shall come up like a lion from the pride of the Jordan against the strong habitation: for I will suddenly make them run away from it; and whoso is chosen, him will I appoint over it: for who is like me? and who will appoint me a time? and who is the shepherd that can stand before me?
hmr: “Ngai ta u, umhmun det chu doin, Jordan chaponaa inthawk chun sakeibaknei angin hung suok a ta; amiruokchu, amaa inthawk chun intlânsiettir vak ka tih; chun mi ama chunga thunei ding chun ruot ka ta; kei ang hi tu am an um hrim a? Tuin am hun mi ruotpêk a ta? Berâm vêngtu ka hmaa ngîr ding chu tu am a na?

en: Therefore hear ye the counsel of Jehovah, that he hath taken against Babylon; and his purposes, that he hath purposed against the land of the Chaldeans: Surely they shall drag them away, even the little ones of the flock; surely he shall make their habitation desolate over them.
hmr: Chuleiin, Babulon chungthua LALPAIN thurâwn a nei chu lo ngai ta u, Kaldaihai ram chunga thiltum a nei tâk le chun. Matheiloin anni chu ran ruol têhai hnûkhmangin um ngei ngei an ta, an chêngna chu anni irâusanin siempêk a tih.

en: At the noise of the taking of Babylon the earth trembleth, and the cry is heard among the nations.
hmr: Babulon lâkna ria chun hnuoi chu ân thin a, hnamhai laia chun a khêk ri chu hrietin a um a,” tiin.
